children.value: The Geometry class holds a collection of vertex array attributes representing a geometric primitive.
A geometry is considered a "primitive" when it can be rendered with a single GPU draw call. Multiple geometry primitives can be composed into a composite geometry using the
To learn more about attributes refer to the
class that holds metadata for each attributes.
Create a pyramid geometry (used in lesson 4 of learning WebGL examples).

The draw mode, or primitive type.

An object with key/value pairs that indicate how various uniforms should be set up before the GPU draw call. The

, optional) An array of numbers describing the vertex indices for each face.
, optional) An array of floats that describe the vertices of the model.
, optional) An array of floats that describe the normals of the model.
, optional) Can be an array of floats indicating the texture coordinates for the texture to be used or an object that has texture ids as
, optional) An array of colors in RGBA. If just one color is specified that color will be used for all faces.
, optional) A custom set of colors to render the object to texture when performing the color picking algorithm.
